business.headline: Budget 2025: Can AI and better financing transform education sector?Union Budget 2025: Experts anticipate that Budget 2025 would focus on AI-driven academic programs along with increased allocations for student loans and decreasing rates on education loans.

Budget 2025: Will government raise basic exemption limit and cut income tax?Union Budget 2025: With inflation and the rising cost of living affecting household budgets, many are expecting the government to introduce income tax cuts, higher deductions, and a more simplified tax structure.

Why did Sebi cancel registration of 4 stock brokers? Check hereIn four separate orders, Sebi (Securities and Exchange Board of India) explained the main reason for the cancellation of the four stock brokers.

Budget 2025: Will defence, railway sectors get a big boost?Union Budget 2025 is likely to provide enhanced support for modernisation of the defence forces, strengthening naval assets and promoting domestic manufacturing.

Budget 2025: These 5 popular deductions are not available under new tax regime  Budget 2025: Interest incurred on home loans is a popular deduction available under Section 24(b) in the old tax regime. However, the same is not included under the new tax regime.

Explained: Why Tata Motors share price fell 9% today Tata Motors stock price: The stock hit the day's low of Rs 684.25. Jefferies downgraded Tata Motors from 'buy' to 'underperform'. The firm also reduced its price target to Rs 660 from Rs 930.

Sensex, Nifty open flat as market awaits cues from Budget, US Fed's next moveStock Market Today: The S&P BSE Sensex was up by 33.36 points to 76,566.32, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 34.50 points to 23,197.60 as of 9:30 AM.

Dr Agarwals Healthcare IPO: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPDr Agarwals Healthcare IPO aims to raise Rs 3,027.26 crore through a combination of fresh issue of 75 lakh shares and an offer for sale of 6.78 crore shares.

Shares of Adani Enterprises, Adani Ports to be in focus today. Here's whyAdani Enterprises reported a rise in profit in Q3 FY24. The company posted a 2.3 times year-on-year (YoY) jump in consolidated net profit.

Axis Bank launches Devanagari PIN for safer banking. Here's how it worksAxis Bank has unveiled the Devanagari PIN, blending technology and tradition to create a banking PIN that's as personal as your favourite memory, but much harder for cyber criminals to crack.

Even Bihar beats Punjab, Andhra, Haryana in fiscal health, shows Niti reportPunjab, Andhra Pradesh, West Bengal, Kerala and Haryana are at the bottom of the Niti Aayog's list on fiscal health. Bihar, an earlier Bimaru state, has managed to outpace its richer counterparts in fiscal discipline. Odisha tops the list among states with the best fiscal management, and is followed by Jharkhand and Chhattisgarh, two surprise states.

Budget 2025: Will Mahila Samman Savings Certificate get an extension?Union Budget 2025: Mahila Samman Savings Certificate has played a key role in encouraging savings among women from the lower-income group and promoting women's empowerment.

What is 'concert economy' that PM Modi mentioned after Coldplay's India showsRock band Coldplay set a new record for the largest stadium concert of the 21st century on January 25-26, drawing over 2 lakh fans in Ahmedabad, surpassing George Strait's Texas record of 1,10,905 attendees.

Budget 2025: Does it make sense to have a unified tax slab?Experts urge government to take the best of both the old and new tax regimes and introduce a unified tax regime that would benefit the taxpayers.

Budget 2025: Old tax regime vs new tax regime; which is better?Union Budget 2025: The new tax regime was first introduced in Union Budget 2020-21 by inserting a new section, 115BAC, in the Income Tax Act for individuals and Hindu Undivided Families (HUFs).

entertainment.headline: Sonu Nigam on AR Rahman: Great composer but not a great singerSonu Nigam says AR Rahman is a great composer but not a great singer. He praises Rahman's secure approach and recalls composing a part of Inn Lamhon Ke Daaman Mein from Jodha Akbar.

Taylor Swift, Travis Kelce plan to buy a house in Kansas City: ReportTaylor Swift and Travis Kelce are reportedly exploring an opportunity to buy a house in Kansas City. Recently, reports about their engagement have been doing the rounds.

In a viral video from the show, Samay's hilarious banter with Amitabh Bachchan left fans in splits.

Bigg Boss's Mahira Sharma dating cricketer Mohammed Siraj? Her mother reactsTV actor Mahira Sharma's mother denies rumours of her daughter dating cricketer Mohammed Siraj. The cricketer was previously rumoured to be dating Asha Bhosle's granddaughter Zanai.

While the show features strong performances from actors Rag Mayur, Sunny Palle and Muralidhar Goud, it gives a sense of déjà vu throughout.

The Storyteller review: Satyajit Ray's vintage storytelling at its most beautifulReleased-Tue Jan 28, 2025The Storyteller is derived from Satyajit Ray's short story. It features Paresh Rawal and Adil Hussain in the pivotal roles, but it's the stories told in the film and the essence of storytelling that elevate the film.
BB 18's Karan Veer, Chum Darang party with Farah Khan, Aditi-Siddharth and othersKaran Veer Mehra along with Chum Darang were among the other guests at Javed Akhtar's birthday bash.

The Mehta Boys trailer: Boman Irani, Avinash Tiwary explore father-son dynamicsThe first full trailer of The Mehta Boys is here, and it promises a heartfelt and layered story about a father-son relationship. Directed by Irani, the film will premiere on Prime Video in February.

The Trauma Code review: Ju Ji-hoon's medical show deserves more than just 8 episodesReleased-Fri Jan 24, 2025The Trauma Code Heroes on Call is Netflix's latest K-drama offering. Featuring a stellar starcast led by Ju Ji-hoon, read our review to find out if it is your cup of tea.
Jonas Brothers announce new Christmas film, to release later this yearThe Jonas Brothers have announced a new Christmas film. It is set to premiere on Disney+ Hotstar later this year.

general news.headline: All 67 feared dead after US plane collides with Army chopper near WashingtonThe mid-air collision between an American Airlines jet and a US Army helicopter near Washington has likely killed all 67 onboard both the aircraft. 28 bodies have been recovered so far.

AAP claims raid on Bhagwant Mann's Delhi residence, police deny chargeDelhi Chief Minister Atishi took to X and alleged that a team of Delhi Police reached Kapurthala House, residence of her Punjab counterpart Bhagwant Mann, to conduct a raid, a claim which was denied by cops.

Previous relationship details, priest NOC: Uttarakhand rules for live-in couplesUttarakhand, which became the first state to implement a civil code, makes it mandatory for live-in partners to register themselves with the district registrar or face a jail term of up to six months.

India to host DeepSeek on local servers to tackle privacy concerns: IT MinisterDeepSeek: Union IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw announced that India will develop its own foundational AI model and an AI safety institution will be established to advance the country's AI ambitions.

Why didn't the Black Hawk turn, go up or down? Trump is asking the right questionQuestions are being raised after footage showed a US Army Black Hawk helicopter flying straight into an American Airlines jet, killing 64 on board. US President Donald Trump has asked why the chopper didn't turn or go up or down to avoid collision. People are also alleging a conspiracy, even as experts call it a one-in-a-million crash.

ED names Siddaramaiah, family, Muda officials in Rs 56 crore land scamThe ED investigation revealed a massive land scam alleging illegal de-notification, fraudulent conversion, and political influence involving Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, his family, and Muda officials, amounting to Rs 56 crore.

Not just airfares, even Kumbh Mela train tickets are burning a hole in the pocketAs many devotees scramble to reach Prayagraj for Maha Kumbh Mela, booking a train ticket has also become a costly affair, with many opting for Premium Tatkal or longer routes.

Ex-minister Suella Braverman says UK could become Islamist nation with nukesFormer UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman warned that Britain could fall into the hands of "Muslim fundamentalism" and become an Iran-style enemy of the West within two decades. She also criticised the Labour government and said UK PM Keir Starmer could not have been "more at odds" with US President Donald Trump.

Akshay Kumar supports PM Modi's fight against obesity, shares weight-loss tipsAkshay Kumar recently backed Prime Minister Narendra Modi's fight against obesity. The actor shared a post on X and listed a few points to maintain a healthy lifestyle and tackle obesity.

Rajiv Kumar should contest polls: Arvind Kejriwal's all-out attack on poll bodyAmid a row over his claim that Haryana "poisoned" Yamuna, AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal challenged Chief Election Commissioner Rajiv Kumar and his Election Commissioners to drink Yamuna water from the three bottles he would send to them.

Watch LIVE: Sunita Williams collects microbes outside the Space StationDuring the Thursday spacewalk, the two astronauts, Sunita Williams and Butch Willmore, will swab the Space Station for microorganisms.

The proceedings keep you on the edge of the seats.

Kohli took part in Delhi's match against Railways at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in New Delhi.

Kohli denied help to carry cricket gear during practice, reveals Delhi managerRanji Trophy: Star India batter Virat Kohli denied taking any help to carry his cricketing gear during practice session ahead of his much-awaited Ranji Trophy comeback, revealed Delhi's Team Manager Mahesh Bhati.

Formula 1: Lewis Hamilton crashes Ferrari during Day 2 of Test in BarcelonaLewis Hamilton suffered a minor crash in his second outing as a Ferrari driver on Wednesday, January 29. Hamilton was taking part in the testing session in Barcelona with his new team.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
